definitions.definition: In the manner of a royal prince's conduct.
A little tower, frequently a merely ornamental structure at one of the corners of a building or castle.

A tower-like solder post on a turret board (a circuit board with posts instead of holes).

The elevated central portion of the roof of a passenger car, with sides that are pierced for light and ventilation.
An abusive, bitter, attack or criticism: denunciation.

definitions.definition: Any of the ninety-nine points that divide an ordered distribution into one hundred parts, each containing one per cent of the population.

definitions.definition: A person in business, or one who works at a commercial institution.
The scientific study of fluids in motion.
The act of spending the night as a guest in another's house, especially when the participants are children.
An overnight guest.

definitions.definition: To assume or suggest to be true (without proof); to take for granted, to suppose.

To interrupt or cut off.

definitions.definition: (grammar, strict sense) Any of a class of non-inflecting words typically employed to connect a following noun or a pronoun, in an adjectival or adverbial sense, with some other word: a particle used with a noun or pronoun (in English always in the objective case) to make a phrase limiting some other word.
A proposition; an exposition; a discourse.

To use a gouge.
A creative artist, especially a film director, seen as having a specific, recognisable artistic vision, and who is seen as the single or preeminent ‘author’ of his works.
A short, sharp or high note or noise, as of a bird or insect.
(radar, sonar, radio telescopy etc.) A pulse of signal whose frequency sweeps through a band of frequencies for the duration of the pulse.
To make a short, sharp, cheerful note, as of small birds or crickets
To speak in a high-pitched staccato
(radar, sonar, radio telescopy etc.) To modify (a pulse of signal) so that it sweeps through a band of frequencies throughout its duration.
To cheer up; to make (someone) happier.
The amount or proportion of something that is wasted or lost by deterioration or other natural process.
definitions.example: The average wastage is 1.5% in the grocery department.

definitions.definition: The periodical turnover of personnel in an organisation by death, retirement or resignation, as perceived by those aspiring to promotion or appointment in the organisation.
Anything lost by wear or waste.
Goods that are damaged, out of date, reduced, or generally unsaleable, which are destined to be thrown away and which are written off as a loss.
The act of abandoning animal carcasses or parts, usually illegal.
A small, hard object, in the shape of a pebble, that sometimes forms in the gallbladder or bile duct; composed of cholesterol, bile pigments and calcium salts.
The headlining band or performer at a concert or similar event; the best-known and first billed musician, comedian, etc., often performing as the final act of the evening.
The interior fabric covering the roof of a vehicle.
To make something less bright.
definitions.example: He dimmed the lights and put on soft music.

definitions.definition: To become darker.
definitions.example: The lights dimmed briefly when the air conditioning was turned on.

definitions.definition: To render dim, obscure, or dark; to make less bright or distinct
To deprive of distinct vision; to hinder from seeing clearly, either by dazzling or clouding the eyes; to darken the senses or understanding of.
(usually childish) Mother.
To treat someone like a mother would; to mother someone.
A time long past.
definitions.example: This word comes from the days of yore.

definitions.definition: In time long past; long ago.
Something sticking out from a surface; a swelling, protuberant part; a bending outward, especially when caused by pressure.
definitions.example: a bulge in a wall

definitions.definition: The bilge or protuberant part of a cask.
The bilge of a vessel.
The outline of male genitals visible through clothing.
A sudden rise in value or quantity.
To look at the stars at night.
definitions.example: It was a very clear night so I paused to stargaze until I got cold and went in.

definitions.definition: The act of gazing at the stars; astronomy.
Having the nature of an improvisation.
A dash.
To run with quick light steps, to scamper.
An increase in size, number, value, or strength.

definitions.definition: The act of growing, getting bigger or higher.
Something that grows or has grown.
An abnormal mass such as a tumor.
A ridge or fold on the cerebral cortex.
Marijuana, as used for smoking.
To reduce to half the original amount.
To divide into two halves.
To make up half of.
To join two pieces of timber etc. by cutting away each for half its thickness at the joining place, and fitting together.
In match play, to achieve a tie or draw on.
definitions.example: to halve a hole or a match

definitions.definition: One who converses with another.
Closely familiar; current; having frequent interaction
Familiar or acquainted by use or study; well-informed; versed
definitions.example: She is equally conversant with Shakespeare and the laws of physics.

definitions.definition: Concerned; occupied.
An umpire.
To act as an umpire.
An electric ray of the genus Torpedo.
A cylindrical explosive projectile that can travel underwater and is used as a weapon.
A submarine sandwich.
A naval mine.
An explosive device buried underground and set off remotely, to destroy fortifications, troops, or cavalry; a land torpedo.
A professional gunman or assassin.
A small explosive device attached to the top of the rail to provide an audible warning when a train passes over it.
A kind of firework in the form of a small ball, or pellet, which explodes when thrown upon a hard object.
An automobile with a torpedo body.
(usually in the plural) A woman's shoe with a pointed toe.
(usually in the plural) A large breast; breast with a large nipple.
A marijuana cigarette.
To send a torpedo, usually from a submarine, that explodes below the waterline of the target ship.
To sink a ship with one of more torpedoes.
To undermine or destroy any endeavor with a stealthy, powerful attack.
A Maori tribe.
A monarch; the ruler of a country.
One who is not a subject to a ruler or nation.
A gold coin of the United Kingdom, with a nominal value of one pound sterling but in practice used as a bullion coin.
A very large champagne bottle with the capacity of about 25 liters, equivalent to 33⅓ standard bottles.
Any butterfly of the tribe Nymphalini, or genus Basilarchia, as the ursula and the viceroy.
A large, garish ring; a sovereign ring.
To occupy exactly the same space.
definitions.example: The two squares coincide nicely.

definitions.definition: To occur at the same time.
definitions.example: The conference will coincide with his vacation.

definitions.definition: To correspond, concur, or agree.
definitions.example: Our ideas coincide, except in certain areas.

definitions.definition: Act or situation by which things coincide; coincidence.
The final (ultimate) syllable of a word or other utterance.
Work done for school, including both in class and homework.
definitions.example: I'm 40, but now that I'm back going for my degree I'm swamped with schoolwork.

definitions.definition: A box holding papers to be transmitted to others, eg, by mail.
An electronic folder serving the same purpose, for electronic mail.
To box better than.
One who acquires.
A bank or financial institution that processes credit card or debit card payments on behalf of a merchant.
An abnormal formation.
An abnormal developmental feature of offspring.
A net or web; something structured or interlinked in a weblike manner.
A collection of goods to be sent, in transit or having been sent
The act of consigning
A line to which a drowning or falling victim may cling.
(by extension) A source of salvation in a crisis.
A means or route for transporting indispensable supplies.
System or structure of vital importance to a community.
On the deck of a boat, a line to which one can attach oneself to stay aboard on rough seas.
A line from the diver to a tender at the surface control point.
A particular crease in the palm.
To supply with inhabitants; to people.
To live in; to inhabit.
To increase in number; to breed.
To fill initially empty items in a collection.

definitions.definition: To fill initially empty slots or sockets on a circuit board or similar.
Not burdened with worries, cares or responsibilities.
Free of encumbrance.
(of property) Not subject to any claims.
To evoke, educe (emotions, feelings, responses, etc.); to generate, obtain, or provoke as a response or answer.
To draw out, bring out, bring forth (something latent); to obtain information from someone or something.

definitions.definition: To use logic to arrive at truth; to derive by reason
To make (an animal) tame; to domesticate.

definitions.definition: To become tame or domesticated.
To make gentle or meek.

definitions.definition: To add up; to calculate a total.
A devil or demon; a malignant or diabolical being; an evil spirit.
A very evil person.
An enemy; a foe.

definitions.definition: The enemy of mankind, specifically, the Devil; Satan.
An addict or fanatic.

definitions.definition: To yearn; to be desperate (for something).

An agency headed by a director, usually a subdivision of a major government department.
A body of directors.

To be transformed from a gaseous state into a liquid state.

definitions.definition: Condensed; compact; dense.
A form of hatha (yoga) that focuses on precision in asana and pranayama
To pick out such parts (of a text) as may serve a purpose; to mutilate; to pervert

definitions.definition: To sift or bolt, to separate the fine or valuable parts of from the coarse and useless parts, or from dross or dirt

To receive a benefit (from); to be a beneficiary.
A negatively charged ion.
Unwilling or unable to forgive or show mercy.

definitions.definition: Having no allowance for weakness.

A rowing machine.
The making and launching of rockets, its science and practice.
Not mobile, not movable
Fixed, unable to be moved
An act of interchanging.

definitions.definition: To mutually give and receive (something); to exchange
To swap or change places

definitions.definition: To act as or carry out an interchange (noun, senses 2, 3).
Not disputable; not open to question; obviously true
